intro: Agrostophyllum kusaiense, commonly known as the Kusaiense grass-leaf plant, is a species native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its inflorescence consists of spikelets that are often clustered at the base of the plant. Agrostophyllum kusaiense is adapted to thrive in environments with moderate to high rainfall.
